flow.header: Follow our guide to pair your Google account with the 2FAS app.

menu.title: Please select the method you use to open Google now

steps.content: Go to **www.google.com** and log into your account.
Click on your avatar in the top right corner and select **Manage your Google Account**.

From the menu, choose **Security**. Go to **How you sign in to Google** section and click **2-Step Verification**.

Click **Get started**.
You may be asked to enter your password for security reasons. Enter it and sign in.
There will be a list of your devices that will get Google prompts. Click **CONTINUE**.
Type in your phone number and click **SEND** or choose **USE ANOTHER BACKUP OPTION** and follow the instructions on the website.

If you've chosen your phone number as the backup option, you will get a text message from Google with a verification code. Type it in and click **NEXT**.

Click **TURN ON** to enable the second layer of verification.

From the section **Add more second steps to verify it's you**, choose **Authenticator app**.

Click **Set up authenticator**.

Scan the displayed QR code to pair the service with the 2FAS app.

You can also do that by clicking **Can't scan it?** and retyping the key from point **2**.
Open the Gmail app, then tap on your avatar in the top right corner and select **Manage your Google Account**.
Go to the **Security** tab and scroll down to the **How you sign in to Google** section.
Tap **2-Step Verification**. Sign in to your Google account and then tap **Get started**.
You may be asked to enter a password for security reasons. Type it in and tap **Next**.
There will be a list of your devices that will get Google prompts. Tap **CONTINUE**.
Enter your phone number and tap **SEND** or choose **USE ANOTHER BACKUP OPTION** and follow the instructions on the website.

If you've chosen your phone number as the backup option, you will get a text message from Google with a verification code. Type it in and click **NEXT**.

Click **TURN ON** to enable the second layer of verification.

Scroll down to **Add more second steps to verify it's you** and choose **Authenticator app**.

Tap **Set up authenticator**.

Scan the displayed QR code to pair the service with the 2FAS app.

You can also do that by clicking **Can't scan it?** and retyping the key from point **2**.
